statement: woman account for 923 percent of the job lost under obama
justification: romneys website said that woman account for 92 3 percent of job lost under obama by comparing job figure with january 2009 and march 2012 and weighing them against woman job figure from booming second by choosing figure from january 2009 month into the recession the statement ignored the million of job lost before then when most of the job loss fell on men in every recession men are the first to take the hit followed by woman it a historical pattern stevenson told u not an effect of obamas policy bruce bartlett a former official in the administration of ronald reagan and george h w bush said much of the decline for woman wa in the public sector to the extent there have been excessive job loss among woman a lot of it ha to do with the fact that there ha been an enormous reduction in state and local government employment bartlett said the decline    ha been especially pronounced in this recession a opposed to other recession this chart from the economic policy institute a laborbacked group bear that out in earlier recession publicsector job began increasing again a the economy stabilized after the most recent recession they have continued to disappear again these are job heavily held by woman bartlett added that many of those government job were eliminated in state controlled by republican governor and legislature this story in the atlantic cited a study by the liberal roosevelt institute finding that the 11 state that went republican in 2010 accounted for 40 5 percent of all state and local government job loss jeff hayes is a senior research analyst with the institute for woman policy research an organization affiliated with george washington university public policy graduate program that receives contribution from group including the annie e  casey foundation and the bill and melinda gate foundation hayes added that there a lag before the lost tax revenue catch up and government job are lost if you break out the 683000 job woman lost between january 2009 and march 2012 64 percent were in government and only 36 percent in the private sector that lead u to a point made by eileen appelbaum with the leftleaning center on economic and policy research she noted that after the first wave of money in the president stimulus bill had run out obama asked for another 23 billion in emergency aid for state and local government the money wa sought to avert the layoff of a many a 300000 public school teacher but house republican leader stripped it you could hardly blame obama for that appelbaum said a for the comparison with the politifact georgia item such direct comparison are tricky the associated press said using the 92 3 percent figure a a measure of obamas record on woman wa dubious at best first read a politics blog by nbc news had this to say doe anyone believe with a straight face that nine in 10 job loss over the past three year have been woman worker and the new york time disputed the emphasis on the job loss occurring under obama president get too much credit or blame for change in the business cycle contrary to what seems to be popular opinion neither mr  bush nor mr  obama had or have the unilateral ability to steer the country into good or bad job market neither would a president romney time economics writer catherine rampell wrote in the economix blog well conclude with this point expert agree that the economic recovery ha not helped woman a much a men howard wall an economics professor at lindenwood university said it fair to fault obama for that i think you have to kind of divide the timeline call it the bush recession and the obama recovery wall said i dont give them the obama administration credit for stopping the fall or causing the fall they had nothing to do with that but they own the recovery doe all this mean that obamas policy have brought hard time to woman
